sentence: Technology stocks were narrowly higher just before Monday's closing bell, with shares of tech companies in the S&P 500 were rising almost 0.3%.

In company news, Facebook ( FB ) shares rose late Monday following reports German authorities want the social network company to be more aggressive monitoring and - when necessary - removing offensive or forbidden content from its online platform.

German interior minister Thomas de Maiziere visited Facebook's offices in Berlin and was quoted as saying that while the company has done a good job cooperating with authorities, it still needed to do more to thwart racist comments, outlawed symbols and appeals for terror, according to a Reuters report.

"Facebook has an immensely important economic position and just like every other large enterprise it has an immensely important social responsibility," de Maiziere told the news service, later urging Facebook to remove objectionable content without being asked.
FB shares were up slightly more than 1% at $126.60 apiece, staying within 2 cents of their session high.
(+) KLAC, Upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform at Cowen & Co, which also raised its price target for the stock by $1 to $80 a share.
(-) CRM, RBC Capital Markets trims price target by $1 to $91 per share and reiterates Outperform rating ahead of software firm reporting quarterly financial results after Monday's market close.
